proof:
Proof. The main part of the proof is to show that for any configuration $F \in \mathcal{B}$ it holds that
$$
c(F) - \frac{2}{d}|E_C \setminus F| \le -\rho n \text{ with } \rho = \eta/20.
\quad(10)
$$
Let us conclude the proof of the lemma assuming (10) for the moment. We first show that (10) translates into $w_C(F)/Z_C \le q^{-\rho n}$ for all $\beta > 0$. Indeed, if $e^\beta - 1 \le q^{2/d}$, we will use the lower bound $Z_C \ge q^{n_c} \ge q^{n(1-e^{-d/3})}$, where the second inequality holds whp. Thus, for any $F \in \mathcal{B}$,
$$
\frac{w_C(F)}{Z_C} = q^{c(F)-n+ne^{-d/3}} (e^\beta - 1)^{|E_C|-|E_C \setminus F|} \le q^{c(F)-\frac{2}{d}|E_C \setminus F| - n + \frac{2}{d}|E_C| + ne^{-d/3}}.
$$
Using that whp $|E_C| \le |E_G| \le nd/2 + \frac{\eta n}{10}$, we have that $\frac{2}{d}|E_C| - n \le n-n+\frac{\eta n}{10}$. Hence, for all $d$ sufficiently large (recall that $\eta$ is an absolute constant independent of $d$), we obtain that $w_C(F)/Z_C \le q^{-\rho n/4}$. Analogously, if $e^\beta - 1 \ge q^{2/d}$, we use the lower bound $Z_C \ge (e^\beta-1)^{|E_C|}$ so that for any $F \in \mathcal{B}$
$$
\frac{w_C(F)}{Z_C} = q^{c(F)} (e^\beta - 1)^{-|E_C \setminus F|} \le q^{c(F) - \frac{2}{d}|E_C \setminus F|} \le q^{-\rho n}.
$$
To finish, note that the size of $\mathcal{B}$ is trivially at most $|\Omega_C| \le 2^{|E_C|} \le 2^{nd/2+n\eta/40}$. Thus we get
$$
\frac{1}{Z_C} \sum_{F \in \mathcal{B}} w_C(F) \le 2^{nd/2+n\eta/40} q^{-\rho n/4}
$$
which is $\le e^{-n}$ for all $q$ large enough.

We next return to the proof of (10). Lemma 52 combined with Lemma 50 together imply (10). 
This finishes the proof of (10) and completes the proof of Lemma 53.
